TaskDescription: You've learnet about TP timer. It starts counting as soon as input is true and turns off after specified time, regardless of the input. The Timer oFF Delay or shorter TOF and Timer On Delay or shorter TON both take input into account. TON timer starts counting as soon as input is true, and when specified time is passed becomes true. It's used to filter out short signals. TOF timer is true as soon as input is positive. On inputs falling edge starts counting and turns off output signal after set time. It's used to extend the signal duration. Link TOF timer to upper blue light (tag LEDBlueUp). The light should turn on when the ButtonBlackLeftDown is pressed and turn off 3 seconds after the buttons falling edge. Comment the code from previous exercise and set LEDBlueDown to TON timer's output. Set it's time to 2 seconds. Start testing as soon as you press the button and hold it for 4 seconds, not more
